channel.title: Basics on Practice Python
channel.description: Recent content in Basics on Practice Python

item.title: Hello World
item.description: Let’s start with basic traditional program that will print “Hello, World!". See following code and Hit submit print("Hello, world!") success_msg("Great job!") Just hit submit button. Explanation One the left hand side you see script.py and on the right hand side you see Ipython shell, its same as terminal, you can directly type command on it and hit enter to execute. inside script.py, we used print() function (we will cover later) and we are passing “Hello World!

item.title: Variables
item.description: What is Variable ? You can think variable as drawers, like you have drawers to store clothes, files, books etc and you know which drawer has which things using the labels or tag. So in programming, you store the data and you labeled it as the thing you refer. Variables are common for every programming/scripting language. Every script/program keep track of stuff, like when you create facebook login you have to feel details like name, age, sex.
